children.description: I am calling the 'geocode_for_dargan' function with the argument '{ "postcode": "CF103AA" }' to obtain the geolocation information for the given postcode. This will help me identify the specific location in Cardiff that the user is interested in exploring.

I am calling the 'in_radius_for_dargan' function with the argument '{ "postcode": "CF103AA", "radius": 5 }' to search for nearby postcodes within a 5-kilometer radius of the given postcode. This will help me find other locations in Cardiff that the user might be interested in exploring.

all the 'distance_for_dargan' function with the arguments '{ "postcodea": "CF103AA", "postcodeb": "CF103RB" }' to calculate the distance between the two specified postcodes. This will help me determine the distance between the user's current location in Cardiff and another nearby location, allowing the user to plan their exploration accordingly.

I am calling the 'distance_for_dargan' function with the arguments '{ "postcodea": "CF103AA", "postcodeb": "CF103RB" }' to calculate the distance between the two specified postcodes. This will help me determine the distance between the user's current location in Cardiff and another nearby location, allowing the user to plan their exploration accordingly.

I will use the "in_radius_for_dargan" function to find postcodes within a certain radius of my current location. This should give me a list of nearby postcodes that I can use to explore the nearby areas.

It appears that the API for calculating the distance between postcodes is also not available. Since both the geocoding and distance calculation functions are not working, I am unable to proceed with the task in the current state. I will call the "Finish" function to restart the task.

Based on the previous action, it seems that the function "geocode_for_dargan" failed because the API doesn't exist. function.name: distance_for_dargan
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "dargan", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Gets the distance between 2 postcodes in KM"

function.name: geocode_for_dargan
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "dargan", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns the latitude and longitude for a given postcode"

function.name: in_radius_for_dargan
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "dargan", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Find all postcodes within a certain radius (in KM) of a postcode"

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.

1.dargan: Limitless radial search from UK postcodes with distance and coordinate information returned
